intro: Psoralea lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Psoralea lanceolata is an erect perennial herb that can grow up to 30 cm in height.
